awd_titl_txt: Carbon Dioxide and Carbon Isotopes in the Taylor Dome and   Vostok Ice Cores
awd_abstract_narration: This award is for support of a program to reconstruct the record  of atmospheric carbon dioxide (and the carbon-13 isotopes of  carbon dioxide) over several intervals, including the Last  Glacial Maximum-Holocene transition, interstadial episodes, the  mid-Holocene, the last 1000 years and the penultimate glacial  period, using ice from the Taylor Dome and Vostok ice cores.  The  major objective of this study is to investigate the phase  relationship between variations of the greenhouse gases occluded  in the ice cores and temperature changes (indicated by oxygen and  deuterium isotopes) during the last deglaciation.  In addition,  the concentration of atmospheric carbon dioxide over the past  1000 years and during the mid-Holocene will be determined in  these cores.

inst.inst_name: University of California-San Diego Scripps Inst of Oceanography
